main_definition: doing something repeatedly or without stopping over a period of time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Constantly occurring in succession, often with little break between instances.
meanings_and_examples.example: The rain continued to fall continually throughout the night.

meanings_and_examples.definition: With no pause or interruption; persistently.
meanings_and_examples.example: She continually practiced her speech until she was confident enough to deliver it flawlessly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: In a way that is never-ending, incessant.
meanings_and_examples.example: He was continually asking for more money despite having already received his full salary.
